text: Yeast and caramel, fruity, amber with a good head, light body, medium carbonation, taste is similar with a strong bitter final, malty...good.
Bottle. Spicy nose, caramel and oranges. Amber-orange color. A bit stale caramel malts, bitter, spicy hops. Decent, but the least interesting thing I have had from this brewery.

UPDATED: APR 15, 2016 Colore ambra, schiuma sottilissima. Bei sentori erbacei e floreali. Ottima bevuta con amarezza giusta, confermo le note erbacee, si avvicina a una inglese. Bella carbonazione. Ottima ale.

Tap @ Ma Che Siete Venuti A Fa.
Pours golden color with a small head. Apricot and orange on the nose, some mild hops. Grassy and fruity flavor, nothing else really. Simple.
3314

Draught (4,6%) @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà
Aroma has apricot, fruity hops and hayish notes. Also minerals and marmalade. Flavour has fruity hops, orange marmalade, some grapefruit and minerals. Hoppy, fruity, juicy and balanced.

A pompa. Colore ambrato, schiuma fine e poco persistente. Aroma erbaceo, seguito da frutta tropicale, pompelmo. Al palato scorre con corpo leggero come da copione, aromi ancora + intensi di pompelmo e frutta esotica, finale amaro accentuato. Ottima birra, elegante e pulita.

33 cl in Teku. Pours a huuge persistent rock frothy white head, really nice; colour is a hazy orange/ amber. Smells hoppy, fruity, peachy, fresh, with a caramel malt background. Tastes fruity, orange, lemon, hoppy, herbs; low initial sweetness, followed by a pleasant low to medium hoppiness, very nice amount of bitterness. Tasty, fruity, refreshing.
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2014 Abundant persistent foam, great coppery colour, citrus and herby notes on the nose, nice bitterness and a long finish with pronounced grapefruit flavours. Great everyday beer.

In bottiglia. Bellaspetto, colore ambrato e una schiuma tutto sommato abbastanza persistente. Naso agrumi, frutta, malto e qualcosa di vaniglia. 
Bel finale amaro che pulisce la bocca, con una discreta astringenza. 
Non ho ben capito che stile sia, però mi è piaciuta.

Color ambrato opalescente, con schiuma che svanisce frettolosamente. Naso leggermente citrico, ma poco pronunciato. In bocca è molto più vicina ad una classica bitter inglese con attacco morbido e delicato, e finale con una punta di amaro.

Bottle @Domus Birrae, Roma
Slightly hazy copper color, good creamy beige head. Malty with spicey hoppyness. Medium-bodied. Some caramalt in the base. Spicey, earthy hoppyness. Good brew, perharps too straightforward.

bottiglia 75 cl, comprata da eataly e bevuta a casa.
Ambrata con schiuma fine poco persistente.
Molto beverina, amarognola e un pò fruttata, un pò troppo timida forse ma comunque godibilissima.

Appearance: Clear amber color with a frothy tan head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Malty, mild hoppy and fruity.Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet, and a nice bitterness. Soft carbonation.Taste: Dominant caramel malty. Mild fruity and a fine hoppy background.Overall impression: Nice ale.Personal stats: On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà in Roma, Italy

25/03/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata, appena torbida, schiuma leggera morbida e a grana finissima, non molto abbondante ma persistente. Naso leggero, delicato come intensità ma rustico, prettamente fruttato e leggermente speziato. In bocca è amara, equilibratissima, appena appena "watery" (piacevolmente), si beve che è un piacere. Corpo medio-leggero, carbonazione corretta. Birra semplice, ben fatta, di grande equilibrio. Scende giù che è una bellezza!

Pours golden orange with a small white head. Nose is orange, caramel, grass and biscuit. The taste is sweet with a mellow tartness typical of a saison with Brett. The mouthfeel is soft, the body is medium and the finish is long. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Una volta scartata la bottiglia dalla velina che la avvolge, rendendola molto chic e forse un po presuntuosa, appare una bottiglia con unetichetta dal fascino rustico ed essenziale. Quello che si versa nel bicchiere dopo aver fatto saltare con un vivace schiocco il tappo a corona ermetico, e un liquido agitato dal colore ramato.
Il profumo e molto dolce, con sentori di arancia e agrumi vari.
Il sapore non e da meno, forse un po diluito in un tuttuno poco graffiante e incisivo. 
Esaurite le note di agrumi ecco salire prepotente la spinta amara del luppolo che bilancia la sensazione in bocca.
il retrogusto e piuttosto secco e asciutto, tendente alla parte amara dello spettro.
Un buon prodotto nel complesso.

Bottle sample.
Cloudy deep golden color, nice white head.
Strong citrus aroma, with herbal hops and candied orange peels. 
Good bitter flavor with balancing sweetness, oranges and earthy saison-like notes.
Medium body, long bitter finish, original and good.
Buona birra non si capisce bene se apa o pale ale stile inglese, diciamo una via di mezzo! Cmq buona amara e con un retrogusto importante!

Capped 750 from Domus Birrae. Pours hazy dark amber with a slight off-white head. Smells lightly fruity. Near med body. Flavor is pleasant mild citrus and light stone fruit over a sllighty toffeeish caramel. Pleasant, but not bitter.

Vintage 2008, batch 24/08, 3 years old, 5.8% ABVHazy amber color; the carbonation in the bottle is high; medium sized frothy head. Even after these years, the aroma shows some delicate, nice fruity notes, and some malt. The mouthfeel is not completely dry, although there is a light astringency; mild malt flavor, with a light fruity touch and a light sourness; quite woody character too; the final is drier and weaker. Still very good.
Draft at Bir&Fud.  Dark golden color, large and thick tan head.  Aroma of white pepper.  Taste has moderate bitterness.  Plain.
At a tasting, thanks Dror, Pours an hazy yellow to orange with a nice head aroma of apricot, grapes, orange and perfume, flavor is bitter with grapefruit, tangerine and malt, medium bodied, Very Nice

Bottle at a tasting. Thanks Dror. Slightly hazy deep golden with a frothy white head. Smells of hops, citrus (lots of orange), nice fruit candies and yeasty notes. Bitter flavor with lots of hops, some fruity sweetness and a long bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Tasty. Not an EPA.

At a tasting, many thanks, Dror, small stable head, hazy light orange colour, aroma of freshly squeezed oranges, peach and nactarine, flavour of grapefruit, mandarine and herbs with a light pleasant bitterness. feels quite light, which is exactly right for the character of the beer. Wonderfull and original.
Bottle. Amber colour not so clear, and mwdium head. Hoppy nose, fruity. Body is light and flavour is not persistent inside the mouth. Again hoppy and light malty taste.
Hazy amber with a lasting off-white head. Malty aroma with some fruit and spice. Malty and fruity flavour with some yeast notes, grape fruit hops and a bitter finish.
In bottiglia da 75 al Kitchen Mon Amour (GE), divisa con Corkscrew e la mia dolce metà. Ottima bitter di Montegioco, beverina al massimo e con un amaro importantissimo.

Bottle @ Papsø-Grand-Tasting, September 2010. Pours unclear golden with a creamy white foam and lacings. Nose is very yeasty. Baking powder. Dry and earthy flavor with a bit of caramel and yeast. Medium bodied.

cloudy yellolw, smooth light yellow to offwhite head.
yeasty, wheaty, hoppy aroma.
my guess is its an ipa.
flavor is bitter, bitterhoppy, sweet, faint malty. full bodied.

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium amber orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, light to moderate hoppy, citrus - orange, light yeast, fruity. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100911]
Bottle at Papsøs - Thanks. Murkey amber - white head. Smokey, fruity, peppery, spicy, herbal light bitterness, light off notes, light yeasty.
Cloudy amber with a medium off white head. Malty aroma with caramel and english hops. Flavor had toasted malt, caramel and hoppy notes. Finished dry and bitter.

75 cL bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with a huge slight off-white head. Aroma is fruity, peachy and mild yeasty. Sweet malty and fruity. Light mellow yeasty. Light peachy note into the finish. Ends medium dry.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a huge orangey head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The aroma has notes of straw, and caramel, leading to a bitter.

Bottle 75 cl. Pours a hazy amber with a huge and frothy off-white head leaving quite some lacework. Fruit and some phenols in the nose. Medium body, sweet fruit and caramel with a phenollic finish. Poor. 110910
molto interessante con gusto di malto e luppoli americani molto beverina e ben fatta
Colore ambrato, sentore leggermente erbaceo al naso, in bocca poco persistente, piacevolmente luppolata.

RurAle di Montegioco, comprata proprio al birrificio ieri pomeriggio e bevuta a Valle Sant Innocenzo (vicino a Cucco). Non posso scrivere apostrofi e accenti, because il sito non li accetta piu e non so come mai maledizione. Comunque ottima ale, ben luppolata con sentori di castagna e albicocca al naso e una beverinita da non sottovalutare.

Draught  Red-amber beer with slight haze; yellow-amber, small head. Chestnut flour nose, some caramel, rather discreet in general. Roasted caramel in the taste again, and a bit herbal, grassy flavour. But, at the end, there’s diacetyl...ow. Light to medium bodied, bit flat, seems undercarbonated compared to other beers. Reasonable ale, maybe not 100% dispensed right.
ambrata, buona schiuma piuttosto persistente. il naso non e molto pulito un po di malto lieviti leggeri difetti in bocca un leggero malto un discreto amaro ma non esaltante nei profumi
